main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a yellow-gray ball traveling at a high rate of speed in Clinton, Pennsylvania on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a basketball., The observation lasted for about 1 minute., The object's course was westward., Comments suggested the possibility of it being a jet aircraft, balloon, or astronomical phenomenon., A military officer documented the report and noted weather conditions as partly cloudy with limited visibility.
